Define repeating schedule. Enter whole numbers only.

extended_input_schema.label: Trigger at

extended_input_schema.label: Timezone

extended_input_schema.label: Start after

extended_input_schema.empty_schema_title: Add variables by giving them a name, type and default value
extended_input_schema.label: Variables

properties.label: P_NO_DAYS
properties.name: P_NO_DAYS
properties.hint: Defaults to nil if not supplied.

block.name: search_rows_sql
block.title: Select rows using custom SQL
block.description: Select rows using custom SQL in Oracle

input.sql:
--  Code developed by SIPAWAR
-- Reference code: "XXRH_ERP_LAPTOP_FULL_PKG"
SELECT SNOW_TICKET_NUM,
             OU_NAME,
             SNOW_BUSINESS_GROUP,
             PO_NUMBER,
             SHIP_TO_COUNTRY,
             MATCH_SN,
             ASSET_NUMBER,
             INVOICE_NUM,
             ASSET_COST,
             CREATION_DATE,
             PR_NUMBER,
             INVOICE_LINE_NUMBER,
             GL_ACCOUNT,
             COST_CENTER,
             Depreciation_Amount,
             Depreciation_Period 
        FROM (SELECT XXLFS.SNOW_TICKET_NUM,
                     XXLFS.OU_NAME,
                     XXLFS.SNOW_BUSINESS_GROUP, 
                     XXLFS.PO_NUMBER,
                     XXLFS.SHIP_TO_COUNTRY,
                     XXLFS.MATCH_SN,
                     XXLFS.ASSET_NUMBER,
                     XXLFS.INVOICE_NUM,
                     XXLFS.ASSET_COST,
                     TO_CHAR(XXLFS.FA_CREATION_DATE, 'DD-MON-YYYY') CREATION_DATE,
                     XXLFS.PR_NUMBER,
                     XXLFS.INVOICE_LINE_NUMBER,
                     XXLFS.GL_ACCOUNT,
                     XXLFS.COST_CENTER,
                     XXLFS.Depreciation_Amount,
                     XXLFS.Depreciation_Period 
                FROM XXRHFIN.XXRHFIN_LAPTOP_FULFILL_FA_SNOW XXLFS
               WHERE 1 = 1
                 AND XXLFS.FA_CREATION_DATE BETWEEN SYSDATE - :P_NO_DAYS AND SYSDATE)
       ORDER BY INVOICE_NUM, INVOICE_LINE_NUMBER

extended_input_schema.hint: First provide the full name assigned to your bind variable in the WHERE condition. e.g. id Second, provide the actual parameter value. Parameter values can be static or datapills. Select the closest corresponding data type that your database is expecting for the bind variable
extended_input_schema.label: Parameters
extended_input_schema.name: parameters

extended_input_schema.hint: Set the initial items in the list. Defaults to an empty list if not supplied.
extended_input_schema.label: Items
extended_input_schema.name: list_items
